intro: Vallesia montana, commonly known as the mountain vallesia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. Vallesia montana is often found in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes.
